topic.title: Question about the Spectrum
topic.text:
https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/zJ4ASIxvqmWnXG2lCZQdd_i_X5wRe7h0CE8IrKVCSOX4b628q60_leiBE3OKTCRI.xKzkXy-zOa35zIUh?startTime=1737731508000

Dr. Sounny discussed the interaction of sunlight with the Earth's atmosphere and objects, including the role of the ozone layer and the concept of black and white bodies in physics. He also explained the use of thermal infrared imaging in studying wildlife, vegetation, and urban heat islands, and the concept of 'windows' in the atmosphere. Lastly, he discussed the properties of different light bands and their interaction with vegetation, as well as the potential impact of light pollution on the environment.
